Class Chord

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • Chord
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChordMessageInterface, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote
    public class Chord
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements ChordMessageInterface
    Chord extends from UnicastRemoteObject to support RMI. It implements the ChordMessageInterface
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • Chord

        public Chord​(int port,
             long guid)
      throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Constructor of the Chord.

        The function is used to debug if the ring is correctly formed

        Parameters:
        port - it is the port where it listen. If the port is being used for another process, it throw RemoteException.
        guid - the global unique id of the peer.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

              throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        It joins the ring in the peer ChordMessageInterface. The peer must exist

        Specified by:
        joinRing in interface ChordMessageInterface
        Parameters:
        s - is the successor
        Throws:

      • findingNextSuccessor

        public void findingNextSuccessor()
        If the successor fails, it tries to handle the failure using the first finger available

      • stabilize

        public void stabilize()
        Stabilizes the chord

        It verifies if the peer is in the right interval. If it is not in the interval, it corrects the interval This method executed by the timer.

      • notify

        public void notify​(ChordMessageInterface j)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        A node notifies that it has a new predecessor j. It also moves all the files that the predecessor must handle

        Specified by:
        notify in interface ChordMessageInterface
        Parameters:
        j - the new predecessor
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • fixFingers

        public void fixFingers()
        Fixes the fingers

        Every time that is executed is fixing the Finger nextFinger. This method executed by the timer.

      • checkPredecessor

        public void checkPredecessor()
        It checks if the predecessor is still alive.

        It checks if the predecessor is still alive. If the predecessor is not present it sets its predecessor to null. This method executed by the timer.

      • checkSuccessor

        public void checkSuccessor()
        It checks if the successor is still alive.

        It checks if the successor is still alive. If the succesor is not present it joins its successor. This method executed by the timer.

      • leave

        public void leave()
        Leaves the ring. It move all files to the successor
